content.text: “Sales reps prepares a quote and sends it to the Punchout User> User receives Quotes via email (with this users will not have to navigate back to the website until quotes are approved internally)”
The assigned salesperson will receive an email upon quote submission to Punchout Users
Upon the quote being provided by SalesRep, the email associated with the PunchOut user will receive a “Quote Provided” email with all quote line items and their pricing.
Upon logging into B2B storefront via the procurement system, the PunchOut user will see the out-of-the-box notification informing them of changes to quotes.
Email Template would have:  (1) Web quote number (2) Quoted part numbers (3) Qty, Price- Link to click
Structure of the Quotes going to a shared inbox
Quotes being embedded in email and not as PDF attachments

content.text: Optimizely will persist order line notes into quote notes. Quote notes can be added by either customers or salespeople, and these notes persist as a quote is archived due to either acceptance or expiration - but the notes will not appear on a finalized order.
Order notes for line items persist as a customer converts a cart to a quote.
Both salespeople and customers - all website users who may access any given quote - can add notes to a line item in a quote.
The “quote notes” persist as a quote is archived into the “My Quotes” page.
The quote notes are removed from finalized, accepted orders and do not have to “live” in the ERP.

content.text: Optimizely to provide the ability for either party - salesperson or customer - to delete a quote line from an RFQ. This could happen for a number of reasons, such as availability or pricing concerns. After deletion, the line item will still display - but with a strikethrough or similar UI element indicating the item was deleted, and by whom.
Order line notes persist when hitting RFQ request and become “Quote Line Notes”
Either the customer or a salesperson can delete line items from a quote.
After deletion, the deletion of the item as well as the user who deleted the item is indicated in the UI in some way.
Impersonating a customer, delete an item from an RFQ list before accepting a quote.
The quote total should adjust accordingly.
The customer should then be able to accept the quote.
Impersonating a salesperson, open a submitted RFQ.
One should be able to delete a line item from the quote.
The quote total should adjust accordingly.
The salesperson should then be able to provide a quote to the customer.

fields.summary: QA for strikethrough UI on deleted quote line items rather than outright deletion

content.text: In present state, customers searching for and adding items to a quote can view the inventory of items they search for to add onto a quote from the RFQ’s  page. We need to extend this privilege to all website user roles so that sales staff can also view inventory for items they will attempt to add to a customer’s cart.
All website user roles can view inventory for items searched inside a quote to which they have access.

content.text: Right now, customers searching for and adding items to a Request for quote can view the inventory of these items.
Salespeople (Administrator role) cannot if they are adding these items in for the customer, and Mellott would like them to be able to do so.

This task will enable inventory view when searching for/adding an item to cart. The ability to search and add an item to cart has already been built, and customers can view inventory, but the permissions to view inventory need to include sales staff as well.

content.text: The “My Quotes” page currently has two behaviors the client would like to change - that quotes expire after a certain period of time, and that quotes converted to orders delete the original quote in the client portal in favor of filing it as an order (thus losing items the customer may have selected for the original quote but are out of stock at time of purchase, for example). Optimizely to provide ability for customers to view previously accepted and expired quotes under “My Quotes” in the customer portal.
When a quote is converted to an order, the quote is not deleted - rather, a copy of  it is stored in the client’s “My Quotes” page for future reference.
Customer can view all quotes accepted under “My Quotes”
Additionally, submitted quotes which have expired will no longer disappear from the client’s “My Quotes” page.
Clients will not be able to accept an expired quote; they should still have the option to add all items to cart to begin a new quote.

fields.summary: As a customer, I want to see all the quotes I've accepted under "My Quotes"

content.text: Mellott wants to flip the logic for their 'Source' attribute value mapping. Right now, if the value coming in is "metso" we set the value to "OEM" otherwise it's "Aftermarket". Mellott has multiple "OEM" values in their system but only one value that would map to "Aftermarket".

This task is to confirm the value of the "Aftermarket" mapping and flip the logic in the Taxonomy post processor to apply "Aftermarket" when the value is appropriate and default to "OEM" in all other cases.

content.text: Shipments aren't being refreshed and updated properly when a tracking  number is changed. This is because we're treating the tracking nubmer as the shipment number. This is causing problems when a tracking number is changed from IFS.
Once Justin responds to this email, we need to revamp the customer shipment refresh processor to map shipments based on the release number instead of the tracking number.
Got it. I think I see what’s causing the new number to not come in.
I need to adjust the shipment refresh to update the tracking numbers but I’ll need to make one clarification about the IFS data.
Each order line in IFS has a release number on it. Can you give me a quick overview on what that field represents and/or how Mellott uses it?

fields.summary: Revamp Shipment Refresh to Key off of Release Number

content.text: I see the new info on the lines for planned ship date. They seem to be the incorrect dates though. Looking at order E100117 the ecommerce site says 10-28-2020 10PM but the planned ship date is 10-29-2020 12:00AM. I confirmed that they are 10-29-2020 in both Arena and IEE. All I can see with a close to same date on the line is planned due date. Maybe that’s what’s being pulled instead? See screenshots

I believe this is behavior that is related to the UTC timezone offset returned from IFS and how ISC is accounting for said offset. All of the date values are coming back as Zulu time in the IFS APIs. ISC adjusts the offset when it stores the value in the database.

fields.summary: Check Planned Ship Date Timezone Adjustments

content.text: Update on the taxes. After testing this afternoon we have determined that the taxes are still being rounded on the order history. Not on the invoices though.

Also, the shipping and handling tax is being put into the shipping and handling estimate instead of the tax line itself under order history. In the end (the invoice) everything comes out ok but it may be confusing to some customers and I’m not sure if we have an obligation to show that as part of the tax broken out from the shipping and handling estimate. I also didn’t find a place where that taxed amount can just be added to the taxes. So we may be stuck but I am not sure.

fields.summary: Review Options for moving Shipping Charge tax to Taxes Column

content.text: We ran into two issues today aside form the tax and tracking that I have already sent notes over on.

1.	When lines from an order have to be cancelled in IFS they are still being delivered back to the Order History on the website. This can be a little confusing, see order E100113. The first Main Shaft order line was cancelled so it shouldn’t be showing up on the customer’s order history.
2.	I adjusted the freight mark up on XPO earlier today and now it seems like it reverted back to just showing the cost for the parts instead of the mark up. Can you look into this?

fields.summary: Filter Canceled Order Lines from Refresh and Test XPO Freight Markup

issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Projects led by the Expert Services team
projectCategory.name: Expert Services

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

content.text: There seems to be a shipment tracking error on the product line when shipment refresh is run after a new line as been added to an order. In cases where the order may have a product with multiple qty and is only partially fulfilled by inventory, we have to add a new line that is either a PO Direct or PO Trans supply code.(Ordered from the supplier) The new line is driven back to the order on the website but it doesn’t seem to provide the correct tracking number on the line. The job history also shows an error has occurred.
See order E100112 and jobs 2818 and 2815 for details.

Additionally, the shipment from the manufacturer/supplier to the customer may have a different carrier associated to it but that would be on the individual PO created to complete the order. Is there a way to update the carrier for the tracking number so its correct? As of now I have seen carriers come through as TBD (E100103) and XPO Logistics (E100112). I’m not quite sure how its determining that value. There also seems to be some additional anomalies on E100103 missing a tracking number and applying the wrong one on another. See screenshots for additional info.

fields.summary: Research Bugs with Shipment Tracking
Check Planned Ship Date Timezone Adjustments

content.text: After showing the website to our internal sales and management team yesterday an important change popped up. Can we get the Planned Ship Date, which is per Order Line, on the product lines on the Order History. As of now we are not communicating when the parts are likely to be shipped out which is one of the most common reasons why purchasing agents call in. I have the below screen shot to explain where in IFS and where on the ecommerce Order History. I’m hoping this is not a heavy lift though I know its last minute. Let me know what you think.
add the custom property to order line, refresh it, then update the view. Estimated at 4 hours, quoted at 6 total with QA.

fields.summary: Create Planned Ship Date Customization on Order Lines

content.text: I’m digging a lot of stuff up here today…

It looks like when I submit quotes there isn’t any tracking system being used so I (the customer) can monitor these quotes. Once, I submit the quote it just disappears. When I (Mellott Company employee) received this email I see it says Request for Quote (Guest). But this wasn’t a guest it was a user. Also, there appears to be a place were you can see your submitted quotes in the account info but nothing appears when I (the customer) submit it.
•	Are we missing out on some of the out-of-the-box functionality when it comes to quotes?
•	Has the guest request for quote customization overriding the standard OOTB quote uses?

fields.summary: Ensure Guest RFQ functionality is different than OOTB RFQ Functionality

content.text: It looks like the XPO mark up isn’t going through. I went in to see if I could fix it but the only carriers I can see are the ones I already have setup for XPO Marion and XPO Warfordsburg. Did we just go through those two or did we create that single XPO carrier that will switch accounts depending on their default warehouse? I believe that was the game plan when we last spoke regarding this.
See the quote I made on the XPO website in comparison to what we are charging. They are nearly identical which is what was making me believe that this is an issue with the markup.

content.text: There are still a few things that we need to get completed before we would approve the SOW.
1.	Invoices totals still aren’t working (rounding issue)
2.	The Order and Invoice Summaries still are not producing the correct Totals and Subtotals (Summation/data gathering issues?) See first screenshot
3.	The XPO Tracking numbers don’t seem to be clickable. The product line tracking info looks good though. (See second screen shot)
4.	The RMA button is still missing from Invoiced orders. (See third screenshot)

content.text: Backorder Bug – Lora has done some research and it appears that the orders submitted by the API do not submit the Purchase Part and the preferred vendor. In the normal EE client it automatically fills out this information but for some reason the parts being submitted from the API and also cannot be changed to PO Trans or PO Direct.

content.text: Invoicing Bug – We have found that orders lines coming from the website can be delivered but not invoiced. Again this is something that IFS generally does automatically when you deliver the order but it misses the Invoicing step and cannot be invoiced after the fact. Lora has not dug into the raw data behind this issue as of yet so exactly what the issue is we are not sure.
